Description: The Flight into Egypt: a night piece; the Virgin seated on a donkey holding the Christ Child, while St Joseph leads the way towards the left while holding a lantern; sixth state with cross hatching over nose of donkey, Joseph's right hand, sleeve and chest, vertical lines added to lower part of light panels in lantern, before posthumous reworking of the plate; Jean de Bary impression, falsification with landscape copied in reverse from Rembrandt's The Raising of Lazarus (New Hollstein 206). 1651 Etching, burin and drypoint Watermark: Arms of Amsterdam (Hinterding catalogue, variant G.b.b.)
Curator's comments: For comment and an impression of first state see also F,4.103. For an impression of the original landscape by Rembrandt, see F,4.149.
Bibliographic references: New Hollstein (Dutch & Flemish) / The New Hollstein: Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts 1450-1700 (262.VI) (Rembrandt)
Hind 1923 / A Catalogue of Rembrandt's Etchings; chronologically arranged and completely illustrated (253.V)
White & Boon 1969 / Rembrandt's Etchings: An Illustrated Critical Catalogue (53.VI)
Acquisition notes: 1843,0513.1 to 504 were purchased from W & G Smith as a group for £543 5s 6d. A few individual prices over £5 were recorded and have been separately entered. Otherwise they are recorded as 12 blocks, each with its own sub-price.
